name: src/catalogue-factory/CatalogueDataObject.js

unknown.tagValue:
alice.cheambe[at]fokus.fraunhofer.de
The CatalogueDataObject class is the representation of the reTHINK Catalogue Data Model

name: constructor
description: Creates the Catalogue Data Object

params.name: guid
params.description:
Global Unique identifier of the Catalogue Object (e.g. Hyperty descriptor, ProtocolStub descriptor,
etc) enabling the same object to be stored and discovered in different Catalogues. That means, guid corresponds to
[resource-type-id] per BNF of Resource Path. Couldn't we have problems with too long URL paths?

params.name: type
params.description: indicates the type of Catalogue Data Object e.g. Hyperty, ProtocolStub, etc

params.name: version
params.description: Indicates the version of Catalogue Data

params.name: objectName
params.description: human-understandable name of the catalogue object e.g. "My Awesome Hyperty"

params.name: description
params.description: description of the source package

params.name: language
params.description: the programming language used in the SourcePackage.SourceCode

params.name: sourcePackageURL
params.description:
A string containing the URL from where the source code package of the corresponding
catalogue object, e.g. deployable packages containing executable code for Hyperties or ProtoStubs, can be downloaded

name: signature
description: Set the signature to enables integrity and authenticity verification

name: createProtoStubDescriptorObject
description: Create ProtocolStubDescriptor

params.name: language
params.description: Programming language used in the SourcePackage

params.name: sourcePackageURL
params.description: URL from where the source code package of the corresponding catalogue object can be downloaded.

params.name: messageSchemas
params.description: Defines the Schema describing the Message Data Model used by the Hyperty through the Catalogue URL from where the Message schema can be reached. If not defined, by default it is assumed the standard Message Model is used.

params.name: configuration
params.description: Data required to configure the ProtocolStub

params.name: constraints
params.description: Describes capabilities required from the Hyperty Runtime in order to be able to execute the ProtocolStub

Core Discovery interface
Class to allow applications to search for hyperties and DataObjects using the message bus

description:
To initialise the HypertyDiscover, which will provide the support for hyperties to
query users registered in outside the internal core.

params.name: msgbus
params.description: msgbus

params.name: runtimeURL
params.description: runtimeURL

name: discoverDataObjectPerName
description:
function to request about an dataObject registered in domain registry with a given name, and
return the dataObject information, if found.

params.name: name
params.description: dataObject URL

params.name: domain
params.description: (Optional)

name: discoverDataObjectPerURL
description:
function to request about dataObject registered in domain registry, and
return the dataObject information, if found.

params.name: url
params.description: dataObject URL

params.name: domain
params.description: (Optional)

name: deleteDataObject
description: function to delete an Data Object registered in the Domain Registry

params.name: url
params.description: dataObject url

params.name: domain
params.description: (Optional)

name: discoverDataObjectPerReporter
description:
function to request about specific reporter dataObject registered in domain registry, and
return the dataObjects from that reporter.

params.name: reporter
params.description: dataObject reporter

params.name: domain
params.description: (Optional)

name: discoverDataObject
description: Advanced Search for dataObjects registered in domain registry

params.name: user
params.description: user identifier, either in url or email format

params.name: schema
params.description: (Optional)     types of dataObject schemas

params.name: resources
params.description: (Optional)  types of dataObject resources

params.name: domain
params.description: (Optional)     domain of the registry to search

name: discoverHyperty
description: Advanced Search for Hyperties registered in domain registry

params.name: user
params.description: user identifier, either in url or email format

params.name: schema
params.description: (Optional)     types of hyperties schemas

params.name: resources
params.description: (Optional)  types of hyperties resources

params.name: domain
params.description: (Optional)     domain of the registry to search

name: discoverHypertyPerUser
description:
function to request about users registered in domain registry, and
return the last hyperty instance registered by the user.

params.name: domain
params.description: (Optional)

name: discoverHypertiesPerUser
description:
function to request about users registered in domain registry, and
return the all the hyperties registered by the user

params.name: domain
params.description: (Optional)

name: deleteHyperty
description: function to delete an hypertyInstance in the Domain Registry

params.name: user
params.description: user url

params.name: hypertyInstance
params.description: HypertyInsntance url

params.name: domain
params.description: (Optional)

name: src/Discovery.js
content:
import Discovery from './discovery/Discovery';
export default Discovery;

name: src/idp/OrangeProxyStub.js
SCHEME
description:
IdentityProxy -- NODE OPENID CONNECT Server

Initial specification: D4.1

The IdentityModule is a component managing user Identity. It downloads, instantiates
and manage Identity Provider Proxy (IdP) for its own user identity or for external
user identity verification.

The IdP contains methods and parameters to actually access and make request
to the IdP Server. Alternatively some functionnalities can be done locally.

name: src/message-factory/Message.js

unknown.tagValue:
alice.cheambe[at]fokus.fraunhofer.de
The Message class is the representation of the reTHINK Message Data Model

name: constructor
description: Generates a message data object

params.name: id
params.description: To be used to associate Response messages to the initial request message.

params.name: from
params.description: URL of Hyperty instance or User associated with it

params.name: toList
params.description:
One or more URLs of Message recipients. According to the URL scheme it may be
handled in different ways

params.name: type
params.description:
The URL of the reTHINK Data Object Resource associated with the message that can be
used for routing purposes

params.name: body
params.description:
Optionally, all message bodies exchanged between different Runtime Messge BUS can
contain JWT tokens for Access Control for Identity Assertion purposes that are inserted by the Identity Module
before the message is routed to proto stubs

name: assertIdentity
description: Adds the asserted identity to the message body and removes the given token from the message

params.name: token
params.description: idToken to remove from message

params.name: identity
params.description: asserted identity to include

name: addIdToken
description: Adds an Id token to the given message

params.name: token
params.description: identity token to include in the message

name: addAccessToken
description: Add an access token to the given message

params.name: token
params.description: token to be added to the given message

name: MessageType
description: MessageType representing the type of message

types: {CREATE: string, READ: string, UPDATE: string, DELETE: string, SUBSCRIBE: string, UNSUBSCRIBE: string, RESPONSE: string, FORWARD: string}

name: src/message-factory/MessageBody.js

unknown.tagValue:
alice.cheambe[at]fokus.fraunhofer.de
The MessageBody class is the base implementation of the Message Body Data Model from which the other body types extend.

params.name: idToken
params.description: token for Identity assertion purpose

params.name: accessToken
params.description: token for access control

params.name: resource
params.description: URL of the object

params.name: schema
params.description: URL of the Data object schema stored in the Catalogue

params.name: assertedIdentity
params.description: AssertedIdentity is compliant with User Identity Data Model

name: addVia
description:
Adds a via URL to the given message body. The "MessageBody.via" attribute contains a list of all Protostub
addresses (Protostub) that the message has been passed through. It is used to prevent infinite cycles in the
Hyperty Messaging Framework.

params.name: token
params.description: identity token to include in the message

name: CreateMessageBody
description: Class representation of the CreateMessageBody object

params.name: value
params.description: Contains the created object in JSON format.

params.name: policy
params.description: URL from where access policy control can be downloaded

params.name: resource
params.description: URL of the object

params.name: schema
params.description: URL of the Data object schema stored in the Catalogue

params.name: assertedIdentity
params.description: AssertedIdentity is compliant with User Identity Data Model

name: ReadMessageBody
description: Class representation of the ReadMessageBody data object

params.name: resource
params.description: URL of the objec

params.name: schema
params.description: URL of the Data object schema stored in the Catalogue

params.name: assertedIdentity
params.description: AssertedIdentity is compliant with User Identity Data Model

params.name: attribute
params.description: Identifies the attribute in the Object to be read (optional)

params.name: criteriaSyntax
params.description:
Defines the criteria syntax used in criteria field. To be used for search purposes.
Valid criteria Syntax are: "key-value", "mongodb", "sql"(?), ...

params.name: criteria
params.description:
Defines the criteria to be used for search purposes. Syntax used to define the criteria
is set in the criteriaSyntax.

params.name: resource
params.description: One or more URLs of objects to be deleted

name: ForwardMessageBody

name: constructor
description: Constructor to create the object

params.name: resource
params.description: URL of the object

params.name: schema

params.name: assertedIdentity
params.description: AssertedIdentity is compliant with User Identity Data Model

params.name: message

name: ResponseMessageBody
description: Class representation of the ResponseMessageBody data object

name: constructor
description: Constructor to create the object

params.name: resource
params.description: URL of the object

params.name: code
params.description: A response code compliant with HTTP response codes (RFC7231)

params.name: value
params.description: Contains a data value in JSON format. Applicable to Responses to READ MessageType.

name: ExecuteMessageBody
description:
Class representation of the ExecuteMessageBoday data Object. Contains the name of method to be invoked and an array
and an Array of objects to be passed as parameters to the defined method. This is compliant with JSON-RPC Spec.

name: constructor
description: Constructor to create the object

params.name: resource
params.description: URL of the object

params.name: schema
params.description: URL of the Data object schema stored in the Catalogue

params.name: assertedIdentity
params.description: AssertedIdentity is compliant with User Identity Data Model

params.name: message
params.description: Message to be forwarded

name: RESPONSE_CODE
description: Represents response code compliant with HTTP response codes (RFC7231).

name: REASON_PHRASE
description: Represents response phrases to response code compliant with HTTP response codes (RFC7231).

params.description: the message request from which the response should be generated

params.name: code
params.description: the response code compliant with HTTP response codes (RFC7231).

params.name: value
params.description: contains a data value in JSON format. Applicable to Responses to READ MessageType.

params.name: source
params.description:
Contains the original creator of the response. Useful to identify the real source of the
response to a one-to-many message delivery ie multiple responses coming coming from different sources.

name: generateMessageResponse
description:
Generate a response to the given Message
Request - Response transactions
A Response to a Request message should follow this rule:
Response.from = Request.to
Response.to = Request.from
Response.id = Request.id
It should be note, the Request.id MUST be incremented every time a new Request message is created.

params.name: data
params.description: Message to be updated

params.name: code
params.description: response code compliant with HTTP response codes (RFC7231).

params.name: value
params.description: Contains a data value in JSON format.

name: src/MessageFactory.js
content:
import MessageFactory from './message-factory/MessageFactory';
export {MessageFactory};

validate
description:
Validates this RethinkObject against the provided schema.

LIMITATIONS: The provided schema cannot contain references to other schemas, since they can't be resolved.

name: src/runtime-capabilities/RuntimeCapabilities.js
getRuntimeCapabilities
description:
Returns as a promise RuntimeCapabilities json object with all available capabilities of the runtime.
If it was not yet persisted in the Storage Manager it collects all required info from the platform and saves in the storage manager.

name: isAvailable
description: returns as a promise a boolean according to available capabilities.

name: update
description: it refreshes previously collected capabilities and updates the storage manager

name: createRuntimeDescriptor
description: Create HypertyRuntimeDescriptor based on raw object that contains its attributes

name: createDataSchema

description: Returns the sourceCode of a given descriptor

params.name: descriptor
params.description: Catalogue Object that was retrieved using e.g. getHypertyDescriptor()

name: getTypeList
description:
Returns the list of available catalogue objects for the given "type URL",
i.e. a catalogue URL that specifies a type, but no catalogue object name.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} typeListPromise - Promise that fulfills with the list of available catalogue object names for the requested type,
rejects on HTTP error or if the HTTP response is not in JSON.

params.name: typeURL
params.description:
URL pointing to the catalogue object type you want a list of available objects for,
e.g. hyperty-catalogue://catalogue.fokus.fraunhofer.de/.well-known/idp-proxy

return.description:
typeListPromise - Promise that fulfills with the list of available catalogue object names for the requested type,
rejects on HTTP error or if the HTTP response is not in JSON.

export {RuntimeCatalogue};

name: src/storage-manager/StorageManager.js
set
description:
Adds a new entry to the database for a given key, together with its version.
If an entry for the given key is already stored in the database, it will be updated.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} result - Promise that will be fulfilled with the key if the entry was stored successfully,
otherwise it is rejected with an error.

params.name: key
params.description: key that can be used with {@link storageManager.get} to retrieve the value object

params.name: version
params.description: version descriptor for the given value

params.name: value
params.description: value stored in the database that is mapped to given key

return.description:
result - Promise that will be fulfilled with the key if the entry was stored successfully,
otherwise it is rejected with an error.

name: get
description:
Get a entry value from the database for a given key.
If no entry is found undefined is returned.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} result - Promise that will be fulfilled with the value.

params.name: key
params.description: key that was stored using {@link storageManager.set}

return.description: result - Promise that will be fulfilled with the value.

name: getVersion
description:
Get a entry version from the database for a given key.
If no entry is found undefined is returned.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} result - Promise that will be fulfilled with the version.

params.name: key
params.description: key that was stored using {@link storageManager.set}

return.description: result - Promise that will be fulfilled with the version.

name: delete
description: Delete a entry from the database for a given key.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} result - Promise that will be fulfilled with the number of affected rows.

params.name: key
params.description: key that was stored using {@link storageManager.set}

return.description: result - Promise that will be fulfilled with the number of affected rows.

name: src/syncher/DataObject.js
DataObject
description:
Main extension class for observers and reporters, with common properties and methods.
Children management is common for observers and reporters.

name: url
description: Object URL of reporter or observer

name: schema
description: Object schema URL (this field is not yet stable, and is subsject to change)

name: status
description: Status of the reporter or observer connection (this field is not yet stable, and is subsject to change)

name: data
description: Data structure to be synchronized.

name: childrens
description: All created children's since the subscription, doesn't contain all children's since reporter creation.

name: addChild
description: Create and add a DataObjectChild to a children collection.

params.name: children
params.description: Children name where the child is added.

params.name: initialData
params.description: Initial data of the child

return.description: Return Promise to a new DataObjectChild.

name: onAddChild
description: Setup the callback to process create and delete of childrens.

name: src/syncher/DataObjectChild.js
DataObjectChild
description:
The class returned from the DataObject addChildren call or from onAddChildren if remotely created.
Children object synchronization is a a fast forward mechanism, no need for direct subscriptions, it uses the already authorized subscription from the parent DataObject.

name: delete
description: Release and delete object data

name: childId
description: Children ID generated on addChildren. Unique identifier

name: data
description: Data Structure to be synchronized.

name: onChange
description: Register the change listeners sent by the reporter child

name: onResponse
description: Setup the callback to process response notifications of the creates

name: src/syncher/DataObjectObserver.js
DataObjectObserver
description:
The class returned from the Syncher subscribe call.
To be used as an observation point from a DataObjectReporter change.

name: delete
description: Release and delete object data

name: unsubscribe
description: Release and delete object data

name: onChange
description: Register the change listeners sent by the reporter

params.name: filter
params.description: Filter that identifies the field (separated dot path). Accepts * at the end for a more unrestricted filtering.

name: src/syncher/DataObjectReporter.js
DataObjectReporter
description:
The class returned from the Syncher create call.
To be used as a reporter point, changes will be submited to DataObjectObserver instances.

name: inviteObservers
description: Send invitations (create messages) to hyperties, observers list.

params.name: observers
params.description: List of Hyperty URL's

name: delete
description: Release and delete object data

name: subscriptions
description: Subscriptions requested and accepted to this reporter

name: onSubscription
description: Setup the callback to process subscribe and unsubscribe notifications

params.name: callback
params.description: function to receive events

name: onResponse
description: Setup the callback to process response notifications of the create's

params.name: callback
params.description: function to receive events

name: onRead
description: Setup the callback to process read notifications

name: src/syncher/DataProvisional.js
DataProvisional
access:
private
This class is responsible for collecting delta changes in remote objects, before the response of subscription reach the observer.
It's used in Syncher -> subscribe. The flow is defined as:
1. (observer) --subscribe--> (reporter)
2. (observer) <--delta updates-- (reporter)
3. (observer) <--subscribe response-- (reporter)
This means that there could be delta updates transferred before the subscription confirmation.
Since there is no DataObjectObserver before the ubscription confirmation, there should be some other object collecting the updates.
Provisional data is applied to the DataObjectObserver after confirmation. Or discarded if there is no confirmation.

name: src/syncher/ProxyObject.js
SyncObject
access:
private
Main class that maintains a JSON object, and observes changes in this object, recursively.
Internal objects and arrays are also observed.

name: src/syncher/Syncher.js
Syncher
description:
The main class for the syncher package.
The Syncher is a singleton class per Hyperty/URL and it is the owner of all created Data Sync Objects according to the Reporter - Observer pattern.
Main functionality is to create reporters and to subscribe to existing ones.

name: constructor
description: Constructor that should be used by the Hyperty owner

params.name: owner
params.description: Hyperty URL owner. An URL allocated by the runtime that uniquely identifies the Hyperty.

params.name: bus
params.description: An instance of the MiniBus provided in the sandbox. When an object (Reporter or Observed) is created, the SyncherManager will add a listener in the MiniBus to receive/send Messages of that object.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration data. The only required field for now is the runtimeURL.

name: owner
description: The owner of the Syncher and all created reporters.

name: reporters
description: All owned reporters, the ones that were created by a create

name: observers
description: All owned observers, the ones that were created by a local subscription

name: create
description: Request a DataObjectReporter creation. The URL will be be requested by the allocation mechanism.

params.name: schema
params.description: Hyperty Catalogue URL address that can be used to retrieve the JSON-Schema describing the Data Object schema

params.name: observers
params.description: List of hyperties that are pre-authorized for subscription

params.name: initialData
params.description: Initial data of the reporter

params.name: objectURL
params.description: reusable dataObject URL

return.description: Return Promise to a new Reporter. The reporter can be accepted or rejected by the PEP

name: subscribe
description: Request a subscription to an existent reporter object.

params.name: schema
params.description: Hyperty Catalogue URL address that can be used to retrieve the JSON-Schema describing the Data Object schema

params.name: objURL
params.description: Address of the existent reporter object to be observed

return.description: Return Promise to a new observer. It's associated with the reporter.

name: resumeObservers
description: Request a subscription to an existent reporter object.

params.name: criteria
params.description: Information to discovery the observer object

return.description: Return Promise to a new observer. It's associated with the reporter.

name: read
description: Request a read action on the reporter object

params.name: objURL
params.description: URL of the reporter object to be read

return.description: Return Promise to last available data of the reporter

name: onNotification
description:
Setup the callback to process create and delete events of remove Reporter objects.
This is releated to the messagens sent by create to the observers Hyperty array.

name: src/syncher/SyncObject.js
SyncObject
access:
private
Main class that maintains a JSON object, and observes changes in this object, recursively.
Internal objects and arrays are also observed.
